evidence.title: README (segment 2)
evidence.excerpt: Backend.AI is a streamlined, container-based computing cluster platform that hosts popular computing/ML frameworks and diverse programming languages, with pluggable heterogeneous accelerator support including CUDA GPU, ROCm GPU, Rebellions, FuriosaAI, HyperAccel, Google TPU, Graphcore IPU and other NPUs.

evidence.title: README (segment 3)
evidence.excerpt: It allocates and isolates the underlying computing resources for multi-tenant computation sessions on-demand or in batches with customizable job schedulers with its own orchestrator named "Sokovan".

evidence.title: README (segment 4)
evidence.excerpt: - **Python**: 3.13.x (main branch requires CPython 3.13.7) - **Pantsbuild**: 2.27.x - See [full version compatibility table](src/ai/backend/README.md#development-setup)

evidence.title: README (segment 5)
evidence.excerpt: **Required**: - Docker 20.10+ (with Compose v2) - PostgreSQL 16+ (tested with 16.3) - Redis 7.2+ (tested with 7.2.11) - etcd 3.5+ (tested with 3.5.14) - Prometheus 3.x (tested with 3.1.0)

evidence.title: README (segment 6)
evidence.excerpt: **Recommended** (for observability): - Grafana 11.x (tested with 11.4.0) - Loki 3.x (tested with 3.5.0) - Tempo 2.x (tested with 2.7.2) - OpenTelemetry Collector

evidence.title: README (segment 8)
evidence.excerpt: - **OS**: Linux (Debian/RHEL-based) or macOS - **Permissions**: sudo access for installation - **Resources**: 4+ CPU cores, 8GB+ RAM recommended for development

### Features #### GraphQL V2 API Implemented the Strawberry-based GraphQL V2 API layer across core entities (User, Project, Domain, Kernel, Image) with full repository and service layers, DataLoaders, nested filter/order support, cross-entity relationships, and scope-based naming conventions following BEP-1041. * Define `KernelV2` GraphQL types with structured fields ([#8079](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8079)) * Add `kernels` resolver to `AgentV2` GQL type ([#8080](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8080)) * Implement BatchQuerier-based `SearchImageAction` ([#8339](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8339)) * Implement `Image` strawberry GraphQL DataLoaders ([#8340](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8340)) * Define `ImageV2` GraphQL schema types with structured fields ([#8396](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8396)) * Add `ImageAlias` support to Strawberry GraphQL schema ([#8400](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8400)) * Implement BEP-1041 scope-based GraphQL API naming convention ([#8467](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8467)) * Add User V2 GraphQL API type definitions ([#8556](https://github.com/lablup/…

evidence.title: 26.2.0rc1
evidence.excerpt: ### Features * Support service definition override in legacy model service creation and dry run ([#6934](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/6934)) * Apply `RBACFieldCreator` pattern to Kernel creation, establishing Session-Kernel relationship via `EntityFieldRow`. Add `FieldType` enum to distinguish field-scoped entities from scope-scoped entities. ([#8035](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8035)) * Apply RBAC Creator and Granter/Revoker patterns to VFolder. VFolder creation now uses `RBACEntityCreator` for automatic scope association, and permission grant/revoke operations use `RBACGranter`/`RBACRevoker` for consistent object-level permission management. ([#8038](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8038)) * Add method based authorization decorator for pydantic migration ([#8046](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8046)) * Apply RBAC Creator pattern to Model Deployment, automatically creating USER scope associations when endpoints are created for proper ownership tracking and permission management. ([#8048](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8048)) * Define `KernelV2` GraphQL types with structured fields ([#8079](https://github.com/labl…

### Features #### Fair Share Scheduler Implemented a Fair Share scheduling system for equitable resource distribution. This system tracks usage by domain and project, adjusting scheduling priorities based on configurable weights. * Add Fair Share and Resource Usage History row models with tests and migration ([#8008](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8008)) * Implement Fair Share and Resource Usage History repository layers ([#8030](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8030)) * Implement FairShareService and ResourceUsageService ([#8031](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8031)) * Implement Fair Share API layer and CLI ([#8033](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8033)) * Implement FairShareObserver with factor calculation ([#8208](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8208)) * Add GQL mutations for fair share configuration ([#8215](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8215)) * Add REST API endpoints for fair share weight and spec management ([#8220](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/8220)) * Add Fair Share weight management with bulk operations and resource validation ([#8278](https://github.com/lablup/backend.ai/issues/827…
